710913f-a.title: Manhattan: 4th Street (West) - Charles Street
710913f-a.text:
253-261 West 4th Street, east side, from rear of 59 Charles Street
to and including Perry Street. 253, the little building, was
erected since 1920. No. 2ol is the 4th Street number of 52 Perry
Street, an old apartment house.
April 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
Ng '265

718622f-a.title: Manhattan: Charles Street - 4th Street
718622f-a.text:
Charles Street, north side, east from and including 4th Street,
and showing in the foreground 5, 4-1 Van Yest Place. The north side
of Charles Street, from 4th to Bleecker Streets, is known as Van
Nest Place, (Originally Van Ness Place) and has its own house numbers,
in order from east to west. See Van Nest Place.
Spring, 1233.
P. L. Sperr.
According to the N.Y. Times, Sunday June 7, 1936 - the nomenclature
Van Nest Place will be eliminated; Charles Street inoorporating same.
These structures will become 59 to 5l Charles Street; Nc. 53 of which
is the Synagogue of the Congregation Darech-Amuno, organised in 1838.

718621f-a.title: Manhattan: Charles Street - 4th Street (West)
718621f-a.text:
Charles Street, east from West 4th Street, as seen across the N.E.
corner of the two thoroughfares.
March 31, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
